snippet: Amid renewed concerns that the city’s animal control programs are inadequate, a growing network of residents is caring for lost and unwanted animals in the Bronx.
abstract: Growing number of Bronx residents are caring for lost and unwanted animals, amid renewed concerns that the city's animal control programs are inadequate; city health officials say that more money and services will be available under increased financing for the nonprofit group Animal Care and Control of NYC, but they also insist that it is unnecessary and costly to have city-funded shelters in each borough.
lead_paragraph: Amid renewed concerns that the city’s animal control programs are inadequate, a growing network of residents is caring for lost and unwanted animals in the Bronx.

headline.seo: Bronx Residents, Without a Nearby Animal Shelter, Help Strays on Their Own
headline.main: With No Animal Shelter Nearby, Bronx Rescuers Are Left to Their Own Devices
headline.print_headline: With No Animal Shelter Nearby, Bronx Rescuers Are Left to Their Own Devices

keywords.value: Animal Care and Control of New York City
keywords.name: organizations
